page.title: 08ECOLOGY
page.content: There is an abundance of wild birds, animals and flowers in the fields, gardens and hedgerows although some of these are decreasing with the cutting down of hedges. Kestrels are often seen hunting for prey. A drainage ditch provides a home for frogspawn but this dries up in the Summer months. Four small ponds situated in fields have a variety of wildlife in and around them. There are several public pathways marked on the map but these are overgrown because of lack of use or blocked off by farmers who do not wish them to be used.
